bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Frederick F. Russell, March 8, 1929

div1.p: Carter updates Russell on the continued progress she and Brown have made redoing bibliographical reference cards in accordance with Frost's suggestions.

div1.head: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Frederick F. Russell, March 8, 1929
div1.opener:
Book. Misel
Report (weekly)
The Westmoreland,
2122 California St., N. W.
Washington, D. C.
March 8, 1929.
Dear Doctor Russell:
div1.p:
This is being written at 8 A. M. in order that I may be
ready to start work on tthe bibliography, as usual, at 8.30.

Miss Brown and I have put in a very satisfactory amount of
work since I last wrote you, working both alone and together; in this
latter connection we put in all of last Sunday, from 9 A. M. to 5 P. M.
and also yesterday evening. Yesterday, indeed, was practically a 12 hour
day for me (a thing I should hate to confess to Dr. Thayer!) However, I
was extremely anxious to get a lot work ready to check with Miss Brown
and it took me all day to do it. Miss Brown is coming up again to-morrow
afternoon and will stay all night--thus giving us our longest available
stretch of consecutive working time together. I must then, put in all
the time I can before her arrival as we “caught up with” with each other's
work last night and made a new distribution of future work of which I
must prepare as much of my share as possible.

Our remaining files of bibliographic cards are, of course,
greatly improved, both in availability and appearance, by our following Dr. Frost's
suggestions as to recasting and retyping; and while I deeply deplore the fact
that his attack of flu last fall, and its sequelae, prevented our working [unclear]
together and finishing things up then, there is no doubt but that the
present plan is best under the changed circumstances. The additional work
for Miss Brown and myself, hard as it has been, and is, is being more than
justified by the results.
div1.closer:
With best wishes to yourself and the work, I remain
Most truly yours, Laura A. Carter, Dr. Frederick F. Russell, Director,
International Health Division,
The Rockefeller Foundation, 61 Broadway,
NEW YORK, N. Y.
